<h3 id="X237">X(237)&nbsp;=&nbsp;X(3)-LINE CONJUGATE OF X(2)</h3>
Trilinears &nbsp;&nbsp; a<sup>2</sup>cos(A + &omega;) : b<sup>2</sup>cos(B + &omega;) : c<sup>2</sup>cos(C + &omega;)
<br>
Trilinears &nbsp;&nbsp; a<sup>3</sup>(b<sup>4</sup> + c<sup>4</sup> - a<sup>2</sup>b<sup>2</sup> - a<sup>2</sup>c<sup>2</sup>) (Darij Grinberg, 3/29/03)
<br>
Barycentrics &nbsp;&nbsp; a<sup>3</sup>cos(A + &omega;) : b<sup>3</sup>cos(B + &omega;) : c<sup>3</sup>cos(C + &omega;)
<br>
Barycentrics &nbsp;&nbsp; a^4*(a^2*b^2 - b^4 + a^2*c^2 - c^4) : :
<b><br>
X(237) = X(237) = 3 X[2] + X[46518], 2 X[3001] - 3 X[22087], 3 X[9155] - 2 X[36212], X[14957] - 6 X[44215], X[21531] - 3 X[44215], 2 X[21531] + X[46518], 3 X[22087] - 4 X[34990], X[34175] - 3 X[38227], 6 X[44215] + X[46518]
</b>
<p>
As a point on the Euler line, X(237) has Shinagawa coefficients (EF + F<sup>2</sup> + S<sup>2</sup>, -(E + F)<sup>2</sup> - S<sup>2</sup>).
</p>
<p>
X(237) is the point of intersection of the Euler line and the Lemoine axis (defined as the radical axis of the circumcircle and the Brocard circle).
</p>
<p>
If you have The Geometer's Sketchpad, you can view <a href= "X(1316).gsp" class="bold">X(1316)</a>, which includes X(237).
</p><p>
X(237) lies on the cubics K380, K532, K782, K783, K789, K1119, and these lines: {2, 3}, {6, 160}, {15, 14186}, {16, 14188}, {31, 904}, {32, 184}, {35, 40790}, {39, 51}, {42, 18758}, {50, 1576}, {55, </p>
<p>

X(237) = psi-transform of X(15920)<br>
X(237) = X(31)-complementary conjugate of X(40601)<br>
